### Exercise 2

a.

![tweet](https://xeno.graphics/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/timemap.png)


b. What marks are being used? What variables are mapped to which properties?
  - Marks: points (circles)
  - Variables: 
    - X-axis: Time before tweet
    - Y-axis: Time after tweet
    - Color Hue: Time of Day

c. What is the main story of this graphic?
  - The graphic tells a story of rhythm and burstiness in human communication.

d. What makes it a good graphic?
  - Clear labels with distinct graphic aesthetic choices to clarify for the viewers to analyze the plot.

e. What features do you think you would know how to implement in Vega-Lite?
  - All the basic implements of the plot (x, y, colors), and couple more codes such as facet, filter, transform, etc..

f. Are there any features of the graphic that you would not know how to do in Vega-Lite? If so, list them.
  - Converting variables into different unit

### Exercise 3


```{r}
library(vegawidget)

  '
{
  "$schema": "https://vega.github.io/schema/vega-lite/v6.json",
  "data": {
    "url": "https://calvin-data304.netlify.app/data/weather-with-dates.csv"
  },
  "mark": {"type": "line", "opacity": 0.5},
  "encoding": {
    "x": {
      "field": "date",
      "timeUnit": "monthdate",
      "type": "temporal",
      "axis": {"format": "%b"},
      "title": "Month"
    },
    "y": {
      "field": "temp_max",
      "type": "quantitative",
      "title": "Maximum Temperature (C)"
    },
    "color": {
      "field": "year"
    }
  }
} 
' |> as_vegaspec()
```


```{r}
'
{
  "$schema": "https://vega.github.io/schema/vega-lite/v6.json",
  "data": {
    "url": "https://calvin-data304.netlify.app/data/weather-with-dates.csv"
  },
"title": "Exercise 2: Average Temperature",
"mark": "bar",
"encoding": {
  "x": {
    "field": "date",
    "timeUnit": "month",
    "type": "ordinal",
    "title": "Month"},

  "y": {
    "field": "temp_max",
    "aggregate": "mean",
    "type": "quantitative",
    "title": "Mean Max Temp"}
    }
}
' |> as_vegaspec()
```
